Method Detail

setPreviewDisplay

public void setPreviewDisplay(Surface surface)
Sets a Surface to show a preview of recorded media (video). You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare()

setFlashState

public void setFlashState(boolean state)
Turn flash on or off if phone has one

setVideoSize

public void setVideoSize(int width,
                         int height)
Modifies the resolution of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare() setVideoQuality() may be more convenient

Parameters:
width - Width of the stream
height - height of the stream

setVideoFramerate

public void setVideoFramerate(int rate)
Modifies the framerate of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare() setVideoQuality() may be more convenient

Parameters:
rate - Framerate of the stream

setVideoEncodingBitrate

public void setVideoEncodingBitrate(int bitrate)
Modifies the bitrate of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare() setVideoQuality() may be more convenient

Parameters:
bitrate - Bitrate of the stream in bit per second

setVideoQuality

public void setVideoQuality(VideoQuality videoQuality)
Modifies the quality of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare()

Parameters:
videoQuality - Quality of the stream

Modifies the videoEncoder of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call prepare()

Parameters:
videoEncoder - Encoder of the stream

prepare

public void prepare()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.RuntimeException
Prepare the VideoStream, you can then call start() The underlying Camera will be opened and configured whaen you call this method so don't forget to deal with the RuntimeExceptions ! Camera.open, Camera.setParameter, Camera.unlock may throw one !

Specified by:
prepare in interface Stream
Overrides:
prepare in class MediaStream
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.RuntimeException
